sentence.Network_en: Music is such a nebulous thing.
The notions we children were able to form of the great world beyond were exceedingly nebulous.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们这些孩子所能形成的对外部世界的认识是非常模糊的。

sentence.Network_en: The evening films began to make nebulous pictures of the valleys.
sentence.Network_cn: 那时苍茫的暮色,已经开始把那些山谷染成一片烟霭凄迷的图画了.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'cloudy'): from French nébuleux or Latin nebulosus, from nebula 'mist'. The sense 'cloud-like, vague' dates from the early 19th cent

entry.def: If you describe something as nebulous, you mean that it is vague and not clearly defined or not easy to describe.

example.ex: The notions we children were able to form of the great world beyond were exceedingly nebulous...
example.tran: 我们这些孩子所能形成的对外部世界的认识是非常模糊的。

example.ex: Music is such a nebulous thing.

sentences.sentence: "gropes among cloudy issues toward a feeble conclusion"- H.T.Moore
"unfixed as were her general notions of what men ought to be"- Jane Austen
